newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Barco falls on 1997 profit forecast.
newsitem.headline: Barco falls on 1997 profit forecast.

text.p: Belgian electronics firm Barco NV fell more than four percent on the Brussels bourse on Thursday on the company's cautious 1997 profit growth forecast and dilution of EPS after the exercising of warrants in June.
At 0830 GMT, Barco was down 4.1 percent at 5,200 francs after earlier touching 5,160.

Barco announced a 33 percent rise in first-half 1996 current profit to 1.305 billion francs on Wednesday but only saw a 10 to 15 percent current profit rise for 1997. The exercising of warrants in June raised the number of outstanding Barco shares by 11.5 percent.
One analyst said he expected Barco to stabilise at current levels for now but predicted further weakness later on, as brokerages started "re-rating" the stock in view of the more cautious outlook.

But another said Barco, the market leader in value terms on the Brussels forward market with a high 27,828 shares traded by 0845 GMT, still remained a growth stock with a good potential for acquisitions.
